title: Gunfire exchange outside US Consulate in Jeddah kills security guard and gunman
description: The attack occurred as Saudi Arabia welcomed some 1.8 million Muslim faithful for the annual hajj pilgrimage in the holy city of Mecca, some 70 kilometers (44 miles) from Jeddah.

title: Titanic submersible: Presumed human remains found in wreckage
description: The US Coast Guard says it has likely recovered human remains from the wreckage of the Titan submersible and is bringing the evidence back to the United States.

title: Madonna hospitalized with a 'serious bacterial infection' postpones her tour
description: Manager Guy Oseary wrote on Instagram Wednesday that the singer had spent several days in an intensive care unit after becoming ill on Saturday. He said the 64-year-old singer is expected to make a full recovery.

title: EU seeks migration cooperation agreements with North African countries
description: At the European Council meeting in Brussels on June 29 and 30, the management of migration to Europe will be at the heart of discussions between heads of state and government.

title: Ukrainian authorities arrest man linked to deadly Russian missile strike
description: Vladimir Putin, trying to repair the damage to his authority, said he 'did not doubt' the support of Russian citizens during the rebellion by the Wagner mercenary group on Wednesday.

title: 'Inflation will force central banks to make trade-offs'
description: On the occasion of the ECB's annual forum, economic editorialist Philippe Escande explains that European central banks will have to make a choice between averting a serious government financial crisis and fighting inflation by raising interest rates.

title: Rwandan former policeman sentenced to life in prison over genocide
description: Philippe Hategekimana, 66, guilty of nearly all the charges against him was sentenced in a Paris court on Wednesday.

title: French High Council on Climate calls to 'acknowledge urgency' and speed up action
description: In its annual report, the independent body considers that France was overwhelmed by the climatic events that hit it last year. It calls on the government to almost double the reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Iran steps up repression as anniversary of Amini's death approaches
description: The regime, keen to avoid a new wave of protests, is particularly targeting women who had taken to circulating without wearing the hijab.

title: Kuran burnt in front of Stockholm mosque as part of authorized rally
description: A man set fire to pages of the Koran outside Stockholm's main mosque on Wednesday, the start of the Muslim holiday Eid al-Adha.

title: German newspaper 'Bild' cuts costs and banks on artificial intelligence
description: A third of the newspaper's jobs are set to disappear. Some functions could be replaced by artificial intelligence tools.

title: Phoebe Waller-Bridge, from successful screenwriter to Indiana Jones' alter ego
description: Acting in 'Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny,' in cinemas on June 28, the British author of the acclaimed 'Fleabag' series is one of the most sought-after screenwriters.

title: Belarus, exile country for Wagner mercenaries and Russia's satellite
description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko said Wagner group mercenaries would be allowed to settle in the country where their leader reportedly arrived on Tuesday.

title: Wagner Group's arrival in Belarus worries Baltic neighbors
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin's exile 'changes the security situation' in the region, according to the Latvian and Lithuanian foreign ministers.

title: Harrison Ford, Hollywood's Mr. Honesty
description: A reminder of a less slick time in Hollywood, as well as a symbol of its sanitization, the actor is back in action for the fifth installment of the 'Indiana Jones' saga.

title: Macron says teenager's shooting by police 'inexplicable' and 'unforgivable'
description: Police shot dead a teenager during a traffic stop on Tuesday in a Paris suburb and appeared to have lied about the circumstances of the killing. The shooting sparked unrest in several Paris suburbs overnight.

title: 'Forever pollution' is everywhere, even in MPs' hair
description: Several PFAS chemicals, some of them banned, were detected in the hair samples of 14 French environmentalist lawmakers. MP Nicolas Thierry is calling for mandatory testing of drinking water.

title: Test firing of V-MAX brings France into exclusive club of countries with hypersonic missiles
description: With the development of this glider, which had lagged behind, France can join other countries such as the US, Russia, China, Japan, South Korea, India and possibly North Korea.

title: Tensions erupt in Paris suburb after police officer put in custody over death of 17-year-old
description: A video that has gone viral on social media has questioned the version briefly put forward by the authorities to justify the shooting.

title: Macron revives the complex issue of school holidays' length
description: During a visit to Marseille, the president raised the possibility of opening a dialogue on the summer break, which he considers too long and a source of inequalities.

title: European Green Pact under threat after vote in EU Parliament
description: On Tuesday, the European Legislative Assembly's Environment Committee voted to reject the Nature Restoration Bill as the right is trying to convince governments on its side to call for a pause in the implementation of the Green Pact.

title: A new legal battle is starting against Total's megaproject in Uganda
description: Ugandan farmers and several NGOs are seeking compensation from the oil major for failure to comply with the French law on due diligence.

title: How Berlusconi personally reconstructed Italy's past
description: The former prime minister shaped Italians' historical imagination through a relativist discourse and the creation of a new kind of party.

title: How Paris's star mammoth was restored
description: One of the world's largest near-complete fossils of the southern mammoth is returning to the Museum of Natural History in Paris, after an epic 13-month restoration.

title: Kevin Spacey due in UK court for sex offenses trial
description: The Oscar-winning actor is due in a London court on Wednesday, June 27, to stand trial for a dozen sexual offenses which allegedly occurred more than a decade ago.

title: US: More than $200 billion in Covid-19 aid may have been stolen
description: The numbers issued on Tuesday by the American Small Business Administration inspector general are much greater than the office's previous projections and underscore how vulnerable the programs were to fraudsters, particularly during the early stages of the pandemic.

title: 4 men arrested in 2022 deaths of 53 migrants trapped in overheated trailer
description: The US authorities announced on Tuesday, June 27, four Mexican nationals were charged with conspiracy to transport immigrants resulting in death, serious bodily injury, and placing lives in jeopardy. The arrests follow one of the deadliest tragedies to have claimed the lives of people smuggled across the border from Mexico.

title: Europeans concerned about Russian weaknesses revealed by Prigozhin's aborted uprising
description: Faced with the growing evidence of power fractures in Moscow, Ukraine's allies believe the priority is to continue supporting Kyiv in its war against Russia.
